derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: diminutive of bird; the golf term from US slang bird, denoting any first-rate thing

entry.tran: （高尔夫运动中的）小鸟球（低于标准杆一杆入洞）
entry.def: In golf, if you get a birdie, you get the golf ball into a hole in one stroke fewer than the number of strokes which has been set as the standard for a good player.

entry.tran: （高尔夫运动中）在…打出小鸟球；以低于标准杆一杆的成绩入（洞）
entry.def: If a golfer birdies a hole, he or she gets a birdie at that hole.

example.ex: He birdied five of the first seven holes.
example.tran: 他在前7洞有5洞打出了小鸟球。

means.word_mean: 1. (golf) a score of one stroke under par on a hole
2. badminton equipment consisting of a ball of cork or rubber with a crown of feathers
1. to shoot in one stroke under par
